channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: France's political crisis just saw the government ousted — but Paris' problems have just begun
item.description: The end of Barnier's short-lived government is just the beginning of a new chapter in France's political and economic crisis.

item.title: Bitcoin falls below $100,000 after reaching the milestone level for the first time
item.description: Bitcoin had been widely expected to reach $100,000 since the U.S. presidential election but investors sent it to this mark much sooner than expected.

item.title: MicroStrategy gives up big gain, turns negative despite bitcoin $100,000 milestone
item.description: Crypto-linked stocks gave up big gains even after bitcoin prices reached $100,000 for the first time ever.

item.title: Lululemon stock jumps as international growth helps to offset slowing U.S. sales
item.description: Lululemon has been in a bit of a rough spot after the departure of its longtime chief product office Sun Choe.

item.title: OPEC+ members to delay oil production increases
item.description: This production cut was previously due to start being phased out in December.

item.title: McKinsey unit will pay $123 million to settle claims it bribed South African officials
item.description: The scheme to bribe two South African state-controlled companies helped McKinsey and McKinsey Africa net approximately $85 million in profits, the DOJ said.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: What lies ahead for India after a big GDP growth miss?
item.description: The recent growth number for the second fiscal quarter, has put a dent on the optimism towards India as experts question what lies ahead.

item.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO shooting: Photos show face of person sought by NYPD for questioning
item.description: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, whose company is the biggest private health insurance payer in the United States, was fatally shot in New York.

item.title: This is the No. 1 personality trait singles are prioritizing in 2025—and 3 signs your date doesn't have it
item.description: Sometimes it takes a few months to unearth someone's character and see if they're reliable and honest. Sometimes, though, you can tell somewhat early on.

item.title: I’ve travelled to 40 countries with my aging parents. It's 'the best investment I've ever made'
item.description: Near-death experiences in Zimbabwe, road trips to nowhere in Cuba. Media executive Todd Miller details how his family used humor to deal with disasters abroad.

item.title: British regulators approve $19 billion Vodafone-Three mobile merger
item.description: British regulators said the tie-up can proceed if both companies sign "binding commitments to invest billions" to roll out a 5G network across the U.K.

item.title: 34-year-old early retiree spends less than $24,000 a year while traveling full time: 'I'm very happy'
item.description: Early retiree Purple has been globetrotting full time since retiring in 2020. Here's how she does it on less than $24,000 a year.

item.title: You only need one thing to ace an interactive AI interview, says CEO who makes them
item.description: Interviews conducted by AI are going to become a norm for job seekers, here's what one CEO whose company makes them says you should expect.

item.title: Ed Sheeran announces concert in Bhutan — with tickets starting at $10
item.description: Ed Sheeran announced this week he's taking his Mathematics Tour to Bhutan on Jan. 24, 2025 — the first major international concert to be held in the country.

item.title: Shell and Equinor to create Britain's largest independent oil and gas company in joint venture
item.description: Britain's Shell and Norway's Equinor on Thursday announced plans to combine their British offshore oil and gas assets to create a jointly owned energy company.

item.title: South Korean President Yoon faces impeachment: How did we get here?
item.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is facing impeachment by parliament after he declared martial law only to revoke it 6 hours later amid immense backlash.

item.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson fatally shot in targeted attack, gunman still at large
item.description: Thompson, who led the largest private insurer in the U.S., was set to attend UnitedHealth Group's investor day, which the company canceled.

item.title: French government toppled in no-confidence vote brought by opposition
item.description: The French government has been ousted in a vote of no-confidence, plunging the euro zone's second-largest country into deep political and economic uncertainty.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: South Korea and its markets are not unfamiliar with impeachment
item.description: One analyst told CNBC if Yoon is quickly impeached or resigns, this could "draw a line" under the matter.

item.title: Britain forecast to reach peak gasoline this year in landmark moment for electric vehicles
item.description: Britain is forecast to hit "peak petrol" in 2024, according to a new report, with EVs on track to assume a much bigger share of the country's car market.

item.title: Far from a bazooka, China's stimulus measures are just trickling through the economy
item.description: China's latest efforts to kickstart growth will take time to play out, data and company earnings show.

item.title: Food prices are at their highest levels in over a year. And these items will get even more expensive
item.description: Global food prices recently rose to an 18-month high, with some food baskets expected to continue climbing, according to market watchers.

item.title: Alibaba-backed Xreal launches augmented reality glasses with new chip as Meta rivalry heats up
item.description: Xreal is betting on glasses, rather than headsets like Apple's Vision Pro or the Meta Quest, to be the mass-market winners in augmented reality.

item.title: Powell says he's not worried about the Fed losing its independence under Trump
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell spoke Wednesday at the New York Times DealBook conference.

item.title: Jeff Bezos says he's optimistic about Trump, will help administration reduce regulation
item.description: Donald Trump and Jeff Bezos clashed frequently during the president-elect's first term in the White House.

item.title: The top books and experiences for the wealthy this holiday season
item.description: J.P. Morgan Private Bank's "NextList2025" includes four museums, two wineries, four Broadway shows and 10 books.

item.title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai says he’d love to do side-by-side comparison with Microsoft’s AI models
item.description: Google CEO fired back at Microsoft CEO's comments aimed at Google's footing in the AI arms race.

item.title: Trump picks Peter Navarro as top trade advisor
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump announced that Peter Navarro will serve as "Senior Counselor for Trade and Manufacturing" in his next White House term.

item.title: Bank of England's Bailey signals four interest rate cuts in 2025 if inflation cools
item.description: The Bank of England governor spoke to the Financial Times about the central bank's projections.

item.title: Robinhood considering move into sports betting, CEO Vlad Tenev says
item.description: The comments came at Robinhood's inaugural investor day event.
